div.p: Translation: from P.Oxy. 12 To Aurelius Philiarchus also called Horion, strategus of the Oxyrhynchite nome, from Aurelius Zoïlas son of Theogenes and Tauris, of the illustrious and most illustrious city of Oxyrhynchus. I swear by the fortune of our lord Gaius Valerius Diocletianus Caesar Augustus that I will present myself before our most eminent pracfect, Marcus Aurelius Diogenes, when he auspiciously visits this place or the neighbouring nome, and will bring an action in his court against the comarchs from the nome now (?) present ... on account of the ... which they wrongly ...
